post_text: HCS is so fortunate to work with some great faith-based partners. Some of the churches who have recently helped with school supplies for our virtual learners include New Covenant Church, First Presbyterian Church, and Joynes Road Church of God. Rev. Dr. Simeon R. Green, III, pastor of Joynes Road Church is pictured here presenting Superintendent Dr. Jeffery Smith with a $500 donation from the Ministers Coalition of Hampton & Vicinity for the purchase of school supplies. #WeAreHCS #LoveOurCommunity

post_text: Thank you Erica Spencer for sharing. We recognize that there will be challenges but we will continue to keep working for all of our students no matter what it takes. #WeAreHCS
shared_text:
Erica Spencer
September 15 at 2:54 PM ·

I am so proud to have my kids in Hampton City Schools. I have seen so many issues across other localities and I just wanna say HCS is on it. Not only did we have Chromebooks prior to the pandemic, they have implemented things to make this process so much smoother. Folks like to say when things are bad so I wanna say when things are good.

Thank you HCS school board, administration, administrators, teachers, and staff. This isn't easy and you all deserve all the props!!!

#EveryChildEveryDayWhateverItTakes

post_text: Today is National IT Professionals Day. It’s a day to honor the men and women we rely on to keep us connected. Our HCS IT team has been working tirelessly to not only keep us connected but assist students, families and staff with technology and trouble shoot access solutions. We are so thankful for our awesome team!
text: Today is National IT Professionals Day. It’s a day to honor the men and women we rely on to keep us connected. Our HCS IT team has been working tirelessly to not only keep us connected but assist students, families and staff with technology and trouble shoot access solutions. We are so thankful for our awesome team!

ADDITIONAL SITES ADDED TO MEAL PICKUP OPTIONS:
Beginning Monday, September 21, one new location will be added to Option 2- Daily Meals from Bus Sites and one new location will be added to Option 3- 5-Day Meal Kit Pickup.

Option 2 - Daily Meals from Bus Sites:
Century Plaza Apartments - 135 Lassiter Dr at Entrance Sign 23666

Option 3 - 5-Day Meal Kit Pickup:
Buckroe Beach Circle - E Pembroke & 1st Street at the Gazebo 23664

Operational hours for all five 5-Day Meal Pickup locations have been ADJUSTED. They will be open from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

DEADLINE REMINDER: The deadline to pre-order student meals for next week is this Thursday, September 17 - http://ow.ly/eCin50BrJja

Please visit the HCS website at www.hampton.k12.va.us for more information on our Alternative Meal Sites.

post_text:
HCS is pleased to offer our 2nd Virtual Learning Workshops for Families. Select from nine sessions - Thursday, September 17; Tuesday, September 22; or Thursday, September 24 (10-10:45 am, 2-2:45 pm, or 6-6:45 pm).

Virtual Learning Workshops for Families (2) will target some of our Technology Frequently Asked Questions to include Google Classroom, Parent Portal sign up and features, as well as Quick Fixes for Zoom and Chromebook issues.

Register here - http://ow.ly/teq350Bq4d8.

Participants will receive an email from the Innovation and Professional Learning Department confirming your registration and a reminder one hour before the webinar begins. We look forward to our virtual experience together!

post_text:
The Hampton School Board will hold a virtual meeting on Wednesday, September 16, 2020, at 6:30 p.m., to ensure social distancing in compliance with the Governor’s order.
The entire agenda with attachments may be viewed on BoardDocs at http://go.boarddocs.com/vsba/hampton/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=BT4JQV4E548A
Public comment is welcome and must be submitted by 12:00 noon on Tuesday, September 1,5 2020, by one of three ways (five minute limit):
Email - to the School Board Clerk at cbowers@hampton.k12.va.us
Phone - leave a voicemail message at (757)727-2011
Live comment - arrange for a live comment by contacting the School Board Clerk by email or phone with your phone number and email address. You will receive a return call to set this up.
When submitting your comment by email or phone, please leave your comment, full name, address, email, and telephone number for inclusion in the official record.
The School Board meeting will broadcast live on WHCS-TV (Cox Channel 46, FIOS Channel 20), and live-streamed on http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/departments/whcs46/whcs.html

post_text:
This is a reminder that HCS is offering THREE meal pickup options during virtual learning and meals must be pre-ordered the week before.

The deadline to pre-order student meals for next week has been extended to midnight this Friday, September 11. Beginning next week, meals will need to be pre-ordered each week by midnight on Thursday nights.

Andrews PreK-8 School and Phenix PreK-8 School have been added as locations to Option 3 – the 5-Day Meal Kit Pickup. These locations are in addition to our current two locations at Hampton High and Syms Middle. Please note that orders for Syms Middle School are at capacity for next week. If you would like to choose Option 3, you may select Andrews, Phenix, or Hampton as your pickup location.

Operational hours for all four 5-Day Meal Pickup locations have been adjusted. They will be open from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.

Please visit the HCS website at www.hampton.k12.va.us for more information on our Alternative Meal Sites.

post_text:
HCS is offering THREE meal pickup options during virtual learning. Students may select only one of the three offered options per week (meal options cannot be combined).

OPTION 1 - School Bus Grab and Go (10 locations; Mon.-Thurs., 10:15 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.)
OPTION 2 - School Curbside Pickup (14 locations; Mon.-Thurs., 10:00 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.)
OPTION 3 - 5-Day Meal Kit Pickup (2 locations; Mon., 4:00 p.m.-7:30 p.m.) -- Due to Labor Day, The 5-Day Meal Kit will take place on TUESDAY, Sept. 8, for the first week of school and are available to families who preordered only

Meals must be preordered the week before pickup - by midnight of that Thursday. Families who did not preorder their meals by midnight last night for the first week of school, may visit the School Bus Grab and Go option or the School Curbside Pickup option next week. Option 3 - the 5-Day Meal Kit - will only be available for families who preordered. Walk ups will not be able to be served for this specific option.

For more information to include locations, times, and days, visit http://ow.ly/4P1s50BisuR.

post_text: School begins next Tuesday, September 8, in a fully online virtual learning model for all students. We want to ensure all of our students are set up for success. Hampton City Schools has options to offer our families who are without Internet access. A signed Internet Access Assistance form must first be completed to determine eligibility. If you do not currently have Internet access, please contact your child’s school as soon as possible to begin the process. Our school offices are open on Mondays through Fridays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.

post_text:
The Hampton School Board will hold a virtual meeting on Wednesday, September 2, 2020, at 6:30 p.m., to ensure social distancing in compliance with the Governor’s order.
The entire agenda with attachments may be viewed on BoardDocs at http://go.boarddocs.com/vsba/hampton/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=BSSJ7B4BC6F0
Public comment is welcome and must be submitted by 12:00 noon on Tuesday, September 1, 2020, by one of three ways (five minute limit):
Email - to the School Board Clerk at cbowers@hampton.k12.va.us
Phone - leave a voicemail message at (757)727-2011
Live comment - arrange for a live comment by contacting the School Board Clerk by email or phone with your phone number and email address. You will receive a return call to set this up.
When submitting your comment by email or phone, please leave your comment, full name, address, email, and telephone number for inclusion in the official record.
The School Board meeting will broadcast live on WHCS-TV (Cox Channel 46, FIOS Channel 20), and live-streamed on http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/departments/whcs46/whcs.html

Individual student schedules for middle and high school will be posted on Parent Portal on September 2. Don't have a Parent Portal account created? Call your child's school before September 2 for assistance to set up your account.

post_text: Do you or someone you know need to register a Prekindergarten student for the upcoming school year? HCS is conducting PreK registration Monday through Thursday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Interested families must call 757-727-2448 to schedule a registration appointment. Parents/guardians may call before and after office hours and leave a message. Messages are checked and calls are returned daily to schedule appointments. PreK will begin September 8 in a 100% virtual setting and all PreK students will receive a device.

post_text: Due to widespread power outages from the storm, our HCS school offices and administrative offices are closed to the public today. In-person appointments will be rescheduled. Staff members are telecommuting today. We apologize for the inconvenience.
shared_text:
Hampton, VA - Gov
August 5 at 7:27 AM ·

The Ruppert Sargent building downtown is without power and will be closed to the public until power is restored. The Hampton History Museum is also without power and will be closed today.

The Ruppert Sargent building houses the Treasurer’s office and the Commissioner of the Revenue’s office, which handle taxes as well as some DMV operations. Also in the building are the Assessor’s and the Economic Development departments for the city and schools headquarters.

The Treasurer and Commission of the Revenue staff should report to work at noon today. Many other city employees in the building will continue teleworking but should check with their supervisor for specific instructions.

Watch hampton.gov/topnews for updates.
text:
Due to widespread power outages from the storm, our HCS school offices and administrative offices are closed to the public today. In-person appointments will be rescheduled. Staff members are telecommuting today. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Hampton, VA - Gov
August 5 at 7:27 AM ·

The Ruppert Sargent building downtown is without power and will be closed to the public until power is restored. The Hampton History Museum is also without power and will be closed today.

The Ruppert Sargent building houses the Treasurer’s office and the Commissioner of the Revenue’s office, which handle taxes as well as some DMV operations. Also in the building are the Assessor’s and the Economic Development departments for the city and schools headquarters.

The Treasurer and Commission of the Revenue staff should report to work at noon today. Many other city employees in the building will continue teleworking but should check with their supervisor for specific instructions.

Watch hampton.gov/topnews for updates.

Captain John Smith Elementary used a COVID-19 grant to send games to families. "These games will open up communication skills between students and in the home. When families decide to play games together in the home the parents get to see their child’s strengths and weaknesses. This then gives the parents a chance to see how they can help their child. Simple board games help players identify colors, counting and develop hand and eye coordination."

post_text: Congratulations to our scholarship recipients! #WeAreHCS
shared_text:
The Exchange Club of Wythe
July 25 at 2:37 PM ·

July 23: Scholarship Award Night is a favorite time of the year because we see the fruits of our labor-our signature Pancake Jamboree and Christmas Tree fundraisers-get rewarded. This year, it came a little later than usual and was held on Zoom due to COV-ID 19. We were fortunate to be able to award five $2,000 scholarships to deserving students. This year’s recipients are Maleek Hill (Hampton High), Joseph Banks (Kecoughtan), Joseph Bowers (Phoebus High), and Khayla Moyer(Bethel High) and a student from New Horizons. Superintendent, Dr. Smith and school board chair, Ann Cherry, were in attendance to support the recipients and thank the club members.

post_text:
Hampton City Schools is excited to share that students, staff, and families now have access to Literacy Pro. Literacy Pro provides around 2,400 e-books for students ages 4-14. For more information on Literacy Pro and directions on how to access the e-books, visit our Virtual Summer Learning by Design website - http://ow.ly/bD1X50Axnc1.

In addition, rising 6-8 grade students can participate in a Zoom Gaming event for each respective book. Twice this summer, certified teachers will facilitate a fun learning activity centered around the book of choice. The Zoom Gaming events will take place on July 28 from 2:00-3:00 PM and August 4 from 2:00-3:00 PM. Students who would like to participate in one of the Zoom Gaming meetings will need to pre-register using the following form - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeHWpgJ4yAi-A4woG63s2-zldL73LE1WldxakNRJab6kppimA/viewform. Students need to be logged into their HCS student accounts to access the registration form.

post_text:
Beginning Monday, July 20, HCS is introducing a new 5-Day Meal Kit on Mondays at our alternative meal site locations from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

These meal kits will include 5 breakfast meals and 5 lunch meals, and will assist our families by reducing the number of days they have to visit one of our alternative meal sites from 3 days a week to 1 day per week.

In the event families can not pick up the 5-Day Meal Kit on Mondays, families will be able to pick up a meal kit on Wednesdays at the Patriot Operation Center located at 1589 Wingfield Drive from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

To view our alternative meal site locations, please visit our FAQs Regarding Alternative Meals for Students - http://ow.ly/ZAg050Axmqm.

post_text: Today, the state Board of Education recognized Hampton City Schools for earning the 2020 Innovative Practice Award. In addition, Armstrong School for the Arts and Tucker-Capps Elementary earned the Board of Education Highest Achievement Award and Bethel High, Kraft Elementary, Lindsay Middle, Machen Elementary, Phenix PreK-8, Smith Elementary, Tarrant Middle, Tyler Elementary, and Eaton Middle earned the Board of Education Continuous Improvement Award. Check out the media release here - http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/news/2020June/innovativeaward.html.

post_text:
The Hampton School Board will hold a virtual meeting on Wednesday, June 17, 2020, at 6:30 p.m., to ensure social distancing in compliance with the Governor’s order.
The entire agenda with attachments may be viewed on BoardDocs at http://go.boarddocs.com/vsba/hampton/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=BQ6STX741E8C
Public comment is welcome and must be submitted by 4:30 p.m. on Tuesday, June 16, 2020, by one of three ways:
Email - to the School Board Clerk at cbowers@hampton.k12.va.us
Phone - leave a voicemail message at (757)727-2011
Live comment - arrange for a live comment by contacting the School Board Clerk by email or phone with your phone number and email address.
When submitting your comment by email or phone, please leave your comment, full name, address, email, and telephone number for inclusion in the official record.
The School Board meeting will broadcast live on WHCS-TV (Cox Channel 46, FIOS Channel 20), and live streamed on http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/departments/whcs46/whcs.html .

post_text: Just a reminder that Hampton City Schools is closed on Monday, May 25, for the Memorial Day holiday. We hope all of our students and staff enjoy the holiday and their families. #WeAreHCS
text: Just a reminder that Hampton City Schools is closed on Monday, May 25, for the Memorial Day holiday. We hope all of our students and staff enjoy the holiday and their families. #WeAreHCS

post_text: Decisions regarding the opening of the 2020-2021 school year will be defined based on guidance from the governor, the Virginia Department of Education, the Virginia Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. We are actively planning for different school opening scenarios. We have established an HCS Reopening Task Force where members of this team are looking at details of how to reopen our schools to include but not limited to staffing, instruction, safety, operations, transportation, and visitor procedures. As we know, there is still uncertainty as to what the health and safety guidelines and restrictions will be in September. We will continue to work to ensure HCS is prepared and communicate with our students and families as additional information and plans are confirmed.
text: Decisions regarding the opening of the 2020-2021 school year will be defined based on guidance from the governor, the Virginia Department of Education, the Virginia Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. We are actively planning for different school opening scenarios. We have established an HCS Reopening Task Force where members of this team are looking at details of how to reopen our schools to include but not limited to staffing, instruction, safety, operations, transportation, and visitor procedures. As we know, there is still uncertainty as to what the health and safety guidelines and restrictions will be in September. We will continue to work to ensure HCS is prepared and communicate with our students and families as additional information and plans are confirmed.

post_text:
In observance of Memorial Day, on Monday, May 25, 2020, our grab-and-go alternative meal sites will be closed. To support our families, three days’ worth of breakfast and lunch items will be distributed on Friday, May 22, to ensure students have meals on Monday, May 25, and Tuesday, May 26. The grab-and-go alternative meal sites will resume their regular operational days and hours on Wednesday, May 27.

As always, it remains a pleasure to serve our families. We hope everyone is staying safe and healthy and enjoys Memorial Day.
text:
In observance of Memorial Day, on Monday, May 25, 2020, our grab-and-go alternative meal sites will be closed. To support our families, three days’ worth of breakfast and lunch items will be distributed on Friday, May 22, to ensure students have meals on Monday, May 25, and Tuesday, May 26. The grab-and-go alternative meal sites will resume their regular operational days and hours on Wednesday, May 27.

As always, it remains a pleasure to serve our families. We hope everyone is staying safe and healthy and enjoys Memorial Day.

post_text:
Today began our celebratory commencement events. The weather may have been damp, but it did not dampen our spirits. We had the best time celebrating our seniors as they picked up their cap and gown, other graduation regalia and a Class of 2020 yard sign!

Our second event, the commemorative photo session at the Hampton Coliseum, will need to be rescheduled based on this week’s weather forecast. Students who were scheduled to take their photo this Wednesday, May 20, have been rescheduled to take it at the same time next Wednesday, May 27. Students who were scheduled to take their photo this Thursday, May 21, have been rescheduled to take it at the same time on Thursday, May 28. Students who were scheduled to take their photo on Friday, May 22, have been rescheduled to take it at the same time on Friday, May 29.

post_text:
The Hampton School Board will hold a virtual meeting on Wednesday, May 20, 2020, at 6:30 p.m., to ensure social distancing in compliance with the Governor’s order.

The entire agenda with attachments may be viewed on BoardDocs at http://www.boarddocs.com/vsba/hampton/Board.nsf/Public

Public comment is welcome and must be submitted by 4:30 p.m. on Tuesday, May 19, 2020, by one of three ways:

Email - to the School Board Clerk at cbowers@hampton.k12.va.us

Phone - leave a voicemail message at (757)727-2011

Live comment - arrange for a live comment by contacting the School Board Clerk by email or phone with your phone number and email address

When submitting your comment by email or phone, please leave your comment, full name, address, email, and telephone number for inclusion in the official record.

The School Board meeting will broadcast live on WHCS-TV (Cox Channel 46, FIOS Channel 20), and live streamed on http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/departments/whcs46/whcs.html .

post_text: Congratulations to Adrianna Thomas for being selected as the Operations and Maintenance Support Employee of the Year! Adriana is a financial specialist in the department and is the sole manager of the front office. She does a fantastic job helping to run the day-to-day operations, while seamlessly juggling multiple tasks while never showing stress and always maintaining a warm and calm demeanor. Adriana's professionalism and positive attitude are infectious and helps to lift the spirits of the entire department.

post_text: Congratulations to Robert Ellis for being selected as the Food and Nutrition Services (FNS) Support Employee of the Year! Robert is a Senior Technology Specialist in the FNS department. Food and Nutrition Services is excited to bestow this recognition to this dedicated, dependable, and reliable staff member. He is a true asset to the department. Robert’s knowledge and efficiency helps keep the department’s technology up and running as well as making sure Food & Nutrition Services is relevant in meeting the needs of our HCS students and FNS staff technology needs.

Sending a huge congratulations to two sixth graders, Gabrielle Hill and Morenike Amussah, who placed in the 9th Annual American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) Hampton Roads Section Middle School Essay Contest! Both girls received Honorable Mention and earned $25 for their essay on the topic, “Where do you envision space exploration and technology in the next 50 years?” Great job Morenike and Gabrielle! Go Panthers!

The award program recognizes outstanding efforts by teachers, administrators, parents, students and community leaders who have made music education part of a well-rounded education.

See the full award listing here: https://www.nammfoundation.org/articles/bcme-2020-districts

post_text:
Check out this opportunity for students! In case you don't know WHRO Public Media can be accessed via antenna 15.2, Cox 107 and Verizon FiOS 460.

RICHMOND — Superintendent of Public Instruction James Lane announced that four Virginia public media stations will broadcast teacher-led classroom instruction aligned with the commonwealth’s academic standards into homes across the state beginning Monday, April 13.

Blue Ridge PBS, VPM, WETA and WHRO Public Media worked closely with the Virginia Department of Education to create “VA TV Classroom” to provide instruction to students in grades K-10 who are unable to access other distance learning options due to a lack of high-speed internet.

“VA TV Classroom” will air instructional content from 1-3 p.m., Monday through Friday.
text:
Check out this opportunity for students! In case you don't know WHRO Public Media can be accessed via antenna 15.2, Cox 107 and Verizon FiOS 460.

RICHMOND — Superintendent of Public Instruction James Lane announced that four Virginia public media stations will broadcast teacher-led classroom instruction aligned with the commonwealth’s academic standards into homes across the state beginning Monday, April 13.

Blue Ridge PBS, VPM, WETA and WHRO Public Media worked closely with the Virginia Department of Education to create “VA TV Classroom” to provide instruction to students in grades K-10 who are unable to access other distance learning options due to a lack of high-speed internet.

“VA TV Classroom” will air instructional content from 1-3 p.m., Monday through Friday.

Virginia Department of Education - VDOE
April 8 at 3:15 PM ·

@DrJamesLane announces that 4 VA public media stations (Blue Ridge PBS, VPM, WETA, WHRO) will broadcast teacher-led classroom instruction aligned with the commonwealth’s academic standards into homes across the state beginning April 13: http://ow.ly/5nxT50z9cAw #VAis4Learners

post_text:
From USAF Heritage of America Band -- HCS is so proud to be a part of this!

Don't Give Up on Me
In this time of social distancing, we can still connect with our local community -- this special version of Andy Grammer's "Don't Give Up on Me" features Full Spectrum alongside Hampton City Schools music teachers and students.

Tag and share with a student and teacher you would like to thank!

#USAF #USAFband #FullSpectrum #FightsOnCOVID #StayHealthyStayReady #PeopleFirstMissionAlways #teleworking #stayathome #WeAreHCS

From our Kelly Dee, HCS fine arts teacher specialist for music education, "I am full of pride over this collaboration! Acclaimed musicians of the USAF Heritage of America Band in Hampton, Virginia, and music educators from Hampton City Schools want our students, families, and community, as well as those throughout our state and country, to know, 'We won't give up on you!'"

post_text: Today is National Census Day! Hampton, please take a few minutes to complete your census. It’s online and easy, and responses are private and protected by law. Census results inform the level of funding for a variety of programs (including education), and participation can make a big difference to our community. Stay at home and complete your census!
text: Today is National Census Day! Hampton, please take a few minutes to complete your census. It’s online and easy, and responses are private and protected by law. Census results inform the level of funding for a variety of programs (including education), and participation can make a big difference to our community. Stay at home and complete your census!

post_text: The U.S. Census Bureau partnered with Good Morning America for a segment on this morning’s show about the importance of the 2020 Census. If you missed it, watch the full segment here.
shared_text:
Good Morning America with U.S. Census Bureau.
Paid Partnership ·

April 1 is Census Day and you can participate right from home! The results of the 2020 Census will help determine how hundreds of billions of dollars in federal funding flow into communities every year for the next decade. TAKE THE 2020 CENSUS HERE: https://bit.ly/2R2pj66 #2020Census

post_text:
3/13/20; 3:15 p.m. - Governor Northam Orders All Virginia K-12 Schools Closed for Minimum of Two Weeks

Shortly after 2:30 p.m., Hampton City Schools received notice that the Governor has ordered that all Virginia K-12 schools close for a minimum of two weeks beginning Monday, March 16, through Friday, March 27, 2020. This includes all of our PreK programs as well.

We will communicate information to our parents/guardians in the next few hours regarding our Alternative Learning Plans and other important information. We thank you for your patience.
text:
3/13/20; 3:15 p.m. - Governor Northam Orders All Virginia K-12 Schools Closed for Minimum of Two Weeks

Shortly after 2:30 p.m., Hampton City Schools received notice that the Governor has ordered that all Virginia K-12 schools close for a minimum of two weeks beginning Monday, March 16, through Friday, March 27, 2020. This includes all of our PreK programs as well.

We will communicate information to our parents/guardians in the next few hours regarding our Alternative Learning Plans and other important information. We thank you for your patience.

post_text:
Update as of 3.13.20

Andrews PreK-8 School will be closed today for all students and staff. It has come to our attention that an individual within the school came into contact with a person who has been confirmed with COVID-19. This individual is not presenting any symptoms. However, as a precautionary measure to allow us to deep clean the school, Andrews is closed today, Friday, March 13, 2020. Please know there are no confirmed cases at Andrews or in our city at this time. This is for precautionary measures only.

Count Me in, Hampton! Join us for a special Census kick-off on Saturday, March 14, from 1 - 3 p.m., at the Town Square in Peninsula Town Center, 1620 Merchant Lane.

Count Me in Hampton! will be an afternoon of fun and celebration. The event will include entertainment, raffles, music & games, food challenges and most importantly, information on how you can get involved on April 1 (Census Awareness Day) when The U.S. Census Bureau will begin a massive count of the nation’s population.

post_text:
Due to HCS being closed for inclement weather on Friday, February 21, 2020, the following adjustments have been made to the 2019-2020 school calendar. Families and staff are asked to plan accordingly.

* Friday, March 6, and Friday, May 22, 2020, will now be full school days for all students and staff. These dates were originally early close days.

In developing the 2019-2020 HCS calendar, a priority was placed on providing a full day off the Wednesday before Thanksgiving and a two-week winter break. Therefore, only one “banked student instructional day” was included in the calendar. This day was used for the school closure on Friday, September 6, 2019, due to Hurricane Dorian. Since this banked time was used in September, calendar adjustments had to be made for missing the instructional time on Friday, February 21.
text:
Due to HCS being closed for inclement weather on Friday, February 21, 2020, the following adjustments have been made to the 2019-2020 school calendar. Families and staff are asked to plan accordingly.

* Friday, March 6, and Friday, May 22, 2020, will now be full school days for all students and staff. These dates were originally early close days.

In developing the 2019-2020 HCS calendar, a priority was placed on providing a full day off the Wednesday before Thanksgiving and a two-week winter break. Therefore, only one “banked student instructional day” was included in the calendar. This day was used for the school closure on Friday, September 6, 2019, due to Hurricane Dorian. Since this banked time was used in September, calendar adjustments had to be made for missing the instructional time on Friday, February 21.

post_text:
ATTENTION: Based on the current weather forecast, we anticipate that Thursday, February 20, 2020, will be a full instructional day. However, due to the prediction of inclement weather later tomorrow, all after-school and evening activities on Thursday, February 20, have been cancelled. We have been advised by the city of Hampton’s School-Aged Programs that they are canceling all after-school care and programs.

We are closely monitoring weather conditions and will inform families if any other adjustments will be necessary.
We will communicate any additional updates by using our Parent Alert System phone call and text, our social media handles, our website, and HCS Channel 46.

December 19, 2019 at 3:52 PM ·

DELICIOUS FUNDRAISER ALERT!!!
Be sure to stop by Sinful Treats, a local bakery that features hand-crafted, made from scratch desserts tomorrow (Friday December 20)! Sinful Treats is located at 1301 N. King Street (the intersection of Little Back River Rd and King St, right next to Smitty's) and is open from 9:00AM-5:00PM. Check out their assortment of cheesecake bars, cupcakes, cookies, cake pops and many other delicious treats, just in time for the holiday season! They will donate 10% of all profits back to Booker Elementary! This is a yummy way to get goodies for your family AND support what we do for the kids at Booker❤️🍪🍰🍥

post_text: Students in Ms. Ames and Ms. Gunder's class at Moton Early Childhood Center used their senses to explore the outside and inside of a pumpkin. Teachers used prior knowledge by asking what students know about pumpkins, how they look and feel on the outside, etc. The students predicted how the inside would look and feel. Once the pumpkins were cut open the students were allowed to observe, feel, and smell the inside. So far the highest number of seeds in the small pumpkins is 126. #WeAreHCS
text: Students in Ms. Ames and Ms. Gunder's class at Moton Early Childhood Center used their senses to explore the outside and inside of a pumpkin. Teachers used prior knowledge by asking what students know about pumpkins, how they look and feel on the outside, etc. The students predicted how the inside would look and feel. Once the pumpkins were cut open the students were allowed to observe, feel, and smell the inside. So far the highest number of seeds in the small pumpkins is 126. #WeAreHCS

Puppets and story of Mary Peake get kids reading in Hampton
text:
DAILYPRESS.COM
Puppets and story of Mary Peake get kids reading in Hampton

post_text: Rainbow Puppets and "Open a Book" presented a wonderful live show at Moton Early Childhood Center that was provided free of charge because of a grant from Optima Health. The reading program offers a variety of literacy services for children and adults, recognizing the positive effect that reading has on life-long health and well-being. Each Moton student and staff members were presented with a book titled The Tall, The Tough and The Tiny at the end of the show. #WeAreHCS

HRSD
October 18, 2019 at 2:20 PM ·

And that's a wrap!
We successfully taught 120 students from Eaton Middle School in Hampton about our Potomac Aquifer this week. Students went on a SWIFT Tour and made their own aquifer in a cup! #SWIFTVA

SWIFT Tours are designed to cover middle and high school science SOLs. Sign up for a field trip at www.hrsd.com/contact/outreach

shared_text:
Hampton, VA - Gov
October 9, 2019 at 7:38 PM ·

Young people drew honors from Hampton City Council tonight. Cadet Captain Joey Bowers was one of 4 people nationwide to earn the Marine Corps Junior ROTC Legion of Valor Bronze Cross for Achievement Award. The Phoebus High School senior was honored with a proclamation. Four Boy Scouts who recently became Eagle Scouts - Nathan Flowers of Troop 915 and Nicholas Risdon, Joseph Bryce and Kelly Parker of Troop 99 - were given City of Hampton pins and coins.
text:
Hampton, VA - Gov
October 9, 2019 at 7:38 PM ·

Young people drew honors from Hampton City Council tonight. Cadet Captain Joey Bowers was one of 4 people nationwide to earn the Marine Corps Junior ROTC Legion of Valor Bronze Cross for Achievement Award. The Phoebus High School senior was honored with a proclamation. Four Boy Scouts who recently became Eagle Scouts - Nathan Flowers of Troop 915 and Nicholas Risdon, Joseph Bryce and Kelly Parker of Troop 99 - were given City of Hampton pins and coins.

post_text:
Edwina Forrest, director of food and nutrition services, and Brittany Dortch, chief financial officer for Hampton City Schools, discuss the Community Eligibility Provisions program.

Watch now on YouTube:
https://youtu.be/nJbEl2fGaxU

You may also view the segments on Cox Cable Channel 46 or Verizon FIOS Channel 20 daily at 9:30 a.m., 12:30 p.m., 3:30 p.m. and 8:30 p.m.

HCS Connects is a television program that will bring you closer to the things happening in Hampton City Schools. This show will connect you to current news, timely topics, and important information, as well as community resources and opportunities for our students.
Get . . . connected . . . with HCS. #WeAreHCS

post_text:
There is still time to complete the Regional Calendar Survey! The survey is open until Sunday, October 6. Please take a few minutes and complete the survey - - https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/CALENDARHCS. The results will assist each school division’s Superintendent, School Board, and calendar planning committee as they develop future school calendars.

Visit our HCS website - http://www.hampton.k12.va.us/calendars/regionalcalendarinfo.html - and click on the 2020-21 Regional Calendar Survey button to view answers to frequently asked questions.
